arm_group.description: All patients with chronic pain conditions participate in a 8-weeks structured group program. Detailed information on the mindfulness based program can be found in the publication by Paul, A. et al. "An Integrative Day Care Clinic for chronically ill patients: Concept and case presentation" in the European Journal of Integrative Medicine, 2012, 4(4):e455-e459.

brief_summary.textblock:
In this observational study the effects of a Lifestyle Modification Program - offered as a
      semi-residential day care clinic - on pain, disability, quality of life and satisfaction
      with life will be investigated. Furthermore the influence of mindfulness, acceptance and
      coping, and acquired changes in lifestyle behaviors on the outcome after the program will be
      evaluated.

      Effects will be measured after completion of the program (3 months), and at 6 and 12 months
      follow up after start of the program, i.e. each outcome measure will be taken 4 times within
      12 months.

clinical_study.brief_title: Lifestyle Modification Program for Patients With Chronic Pain Conditions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  18-78

          -  diagnosed with any chronic pain condition

          -  physical and mental ability to participate in the program and the study

          -  written informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  participation in any other clinical study focusing on psychological or behavioral
             intervention

study_pop.textblock: 200 patients with pain condition admitted to the lifestyle modification program

intervention.other_name: see Paul, A. et al.,Eur J Integr Med 2012, 4(4):e455-e459.

facility.name: Department of Internal and Integrative Medicine, Kliniken Essen-Mitte

clinical_study.official_title: Process-outcome-study in the Context of a Lifestyle Modification Program for Patients With Chronic Pain Conditions

other_outcome.description:
Ability and will to change (Büssing, 2008)
- also evaluated at 6 and 12 months

Translated body awareness questionnaire will be validated. It will further be used for mediation and moderator analysis with the outcomes.
- Body Awareness Questionnaire (BAQ) (Shields 1989)

Translated body awareness questionnaire will be validated. It will further be used for mediation and moderator analysis with the outcomes.
- Body Responsiveness Scale (BRS)(Daubenmier 2005)

Translated body awareness questionnaire will be validated. It will further be used for mediation and moderator analysis with the outcomes.
- Scale of Body Connection (SBC)(Price and Thompson 2007)

Newly developed body awareness questionnaire will be validated. It will further be used for mediation and moderator analysis with the outcomes.
- Postural Awareness Scale (PAS) (Cramer et al.)

The DKB will be used for mediation and moderator analysis with the outcomes and for validation purposes.
- Dresdner Körperbildfragebogen (DKB)(Pöhlmann et al., 2007)

primary_outcome.description: Pain intensity according to the German Pain Questionnaire (DSF) (Pfingsten et al., 2007), visual analogue scales

secondary_outcome.description: pain related disability in the domains everyday activity, leisure and work time, visual analogue scales
Pain Disability Index (Dillmann et al., 1994) validated questionnaire
Brief Multidimensional Life Satisfaction Scale (BMLSS) [Büssing & Fischer, 2009]
Emotional/Rational Disease Acceptance Questionnaire [Büssing et al., 2008, 2010]
Questionnaire for pain specific self efficacy (FESS) [Mangels et al., 2009)
modified Freiburger Mindfulness Inventory (Büssing et al.)
Inner Congruence with the exercise practise of meditation/relaxation/yoga ... (Büssing et al., 2011)
Patients fill in a week long diary. Measured are the frequency of health behaviors
- satisfaction with the program and perceived benefit

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
